  • Constructor Details

    • HostServer

      public HostServer(int port, ClientHandler ch)
      The HostServer function is the constructor for the HostServer class. It takes in a port number and a ClientHandler object, and initializes its serverSocket to null, as well as creating new HashMaps for socketMap and modelReceivers. The gameIsRunning boolean is set to false by default, while timerTask is initialized to null.
      Parameters:
      port - int Set the port number for the server
      ch - ClientHandler Create a new thread for each client that connects to the server

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      The startGame function is responsible for starting the game. It does this by calling the startGame function in GameManager, which sets up all of the necessary variables and starts a new thread to run the game loop.

    • getServerStatus

      public boolean getServerStatus()
      The getServerStatus function returns the boolean value of gameIsRunning.
      Returns:
      A boolean value

    • close

      public void close()
      The close function is called when the user closes the window. It cancels any running timers, resets the current task to null, and then calls super.close()
      Overrides:
      close in class MyServer
